comments:
In a clean install of Eclipse 3.1RC2, install the 1.0.3 plugin at 
  http://eclipseexeditor.sourceforge.net/updates
Restart the workbench. Eclipse crashes. Try to restart a new Eclipse instance
and it still crashes. Log is below. The error appears to be 
in code to convert 2.1 key bindings. 
plugin.xml is at 

 
http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/*checkout*/eclipseexeditor/net.sf.eclipseexeditor/plugin.xml?rev=1.7

This works in 3.0 and in 3.1M-something (I think 3.1M6) but crashes in 3.1RC2

.log file below :

I believe this is due to invalid syntax for the emacsAcceleratorConfiguration
i.e. "Ctrl-x Alt-&"

<keyBinding scope="org.eclipse.ui.textEditorScope"
command="net.sf.eclipseexeditor.quote"
configuration="org.eclipse.ui.emacsAcceleratorConfiguration" string="Ctrl-x
Alt+&">
      </keyBinding>

I changed this to use newer non-deprecated notation, i.e.
      <keyBinding
            contextId="org.eclipse.ui.textEditorScope"
            commandId="net.sf.eclipseexeditor.quote"
            keyConfigurationId="org.eclipse.ui.emacsAcceleratorConfiguration"
            keySequence="M1+x M3+&">
      </keyBinding>

and installed this modified plugin from a local update site and Eclipse 3.1RC2
now starts.

Here is a better URL for the plugin.xml -- it uses a text/plain content-type so
the Alt+& and similar key binding notatin is preserved.

http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/*checkout*/eclipseexeditor/net.sf.eclipseexeditor/plugin.xml?content-type=text%2Fplain&rev=1.7

The problem is that the "Ctrl-x" is not recognized because of the '-' separator
character.  In 3.0.2 and the early milestones of 3.1, this key binding would
have loaded by the workbench as "Null Alt+&".  In other words, the binding would
not have worked.

I can make it so that the workbench doesn't fail quite so spectacularly in the
case of an IllegalArgumentException while parsing the registry.  It should just
log the problem.

MVM: Approval for 3.1 RC3?

Created an attachment (id=23328)
Patch to "BindingPersistence"

This catches the exception, and adds a warning to be logged.

Verified by running everything a self-hosted workspace with only that key
binding added.
verified no crash on 3.1 RC3 on Linux/Motif
